intro: Canthium vatkeanum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It is often found in open woodlands and savannas, thriving in well-drained soils. Canthium vatkeanum is also known for its latex-like sap, which can be toxic to animals and humans.
